They are safer from a clashing perspective. More importantly, that's where=
 most proposals are going because the existing use of relationships in HTML=
 and XHTML family of languages had a restriction of using profile=3D which =
no one uses.

 

And then you have the whole CURIEs in RDFa for relationshi=
ps proposal, which is quite a mess at the moment, but still is URIs in RELs=
.

 

It's just a safer bet from a web arch point of view.

 

Seb

On Mon, Jun 1, 2009 at =

URIs are safer.


On Ju=
n 1, 2009, at 1:06 PM, Ebenezer Ikonne wrote:



What's been the format of =
these rel values?

rel =3D "myValue" or
rel =3D "http://www.domain.com/rel/=
myValue"

On Mon, Jun 1, 2009 at 3:52 PM, mike amundsen <mamund@...> =
wrote:





Recently, I've been toying with clients that can scan for pre-d=
efined
rel values. I use this pattern to write "bots" that can be
"programm=
ed" by the server via links.

I've also used pre-defined rel values to give=
 non-HTML clients hints
on how (and where) to display links to the user.

mca

uld

raged.
